trans-unit.source: Represents core pieces of custom personalization state information contained in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> object.
This class cannot be inherited.

This class represents pieces of custom state information contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> object made available by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IPersonalizable> interface.
This information is used by other classes and interfaces in the personalization infrastructure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> class using the specified value and scope.
Note that the custom state information contained in the `value` parameter must have an associated scope as specified in the `scope` parameter.

Entries in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> must explicitly indicate whether a piece of custom data is considered personalizable in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope.
In this constructor, the value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute.IsSensitive%2A> property defaults to `false`.
An object of personalization data associated with the personalization scope in the scope parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope"></xref> that applies to the custom personalization information.
scope is set to a value that is not a valid member of .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> class using the provided parameters.
This constructor allows you to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> that contains data that should not be serialized in the exported Web Part format.
If you set the value of `isSensitive` to `true`, the Web Parts export handler will not serialize the data for export.
An object of personalization data associated with the personalization scope in the scope parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope"></xref> that applies to the custom personalization information.
A Boolean value indicating if the custom state information is sensitive and should not be exported.
Gets or sets the Boolean value that indicates if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> contains sensitive information.
Web Parts personalization information can contain sensitive data that should not be exported to other controls.
This property is used by the Web Parts import and export process.
Setting <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute.IsSensitive%2A> to `true` causes the Web Parts export handler to not serialize the data in the exported Web Part format.
`true` if the sensitive setting for the attribute is set; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the personalization scope associated with this personalization data entry.
This property's effect is similar to specifying the scope associated with a public property using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute> class.
You can use this property to set the personalization scope of the personalization information that makes up the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> instance.
All entries must have a scope associated with it.
The personalization scope associated with this personalization data entry.
scope is set to a value that is not a valid member of .
Gets or sets the personalization state information for this entry.
Note that the custom state information contained in this property must have an associated scope, specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry.Scope%2A> property.
This property can be set to `null`.
An object representing personalization state information.
